<title level="1" right="Creature Family">[Flea](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=117)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On](/Sources.aspx?ID=21) pg. 83</row>

Fleas are little more than a nuisance in most circumstances, but can be lethal when they grow to monstrous proportions or gather in enormous swarms.

<title level="2">Members</title>
[Flea Swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=502) (Creature 5), [Giant Flea](/Monsters.aspx?ID=501) (Creature 3)

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png">Flea Allies</title>

Flea swarms and giant fleas make for natural pets and monstrous minions for creatures who live in areas of filth and concentrated populations. [Goblins](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=55) and [gremlins](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=58) are unperturbed by fleas’ disturbing physiologies and are unfazed (though not necessarily unaffected) by the diseases these vermin carry. [Ratfolk](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=105) have been known to tame giant fleas for use as mounts, and urban-dwelling [druids](/Classes.aspx?ID=5) whose magic focuses on blight or disease naturally find much to like about the flea swarms they frequently summon.
</aside>
